physical_examinations.relevant_findings: The patient reported progressive numbness and burning in both feet, particularly on the dorsal aspect, for 6 months. Neurologic evaluation found slightly reduced pinprick and vibratory sensation in the toes bilaterally, with no other abnormalities.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The burning sensation resolved three months after atorvastatin therapy was discontinued.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Following a mechanical mitral valve replacement, the patient initially exhibited right upper-extremity weakness and blurred vision, with no intraoperative complications.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The patient later developed fever and purplish discoloration of fingers and toes, requiring additional interventions.
